senses.de: To have to give something back to someone because they gave it to you or because you took it
senses.ex: I owe you a lunch for all the help you gave me last week.

Tips.title: Return Promises
Tips.description: Use 'owe' when expressing the need to return a favor or keep a promise.
Tips.example: Since you covered my shift, I owe you one.

Tips.title: Emphasize Obligation
Tips.description: 'Owe' highlights the obligation felt to repay others for their actions or gifts.
Tips.example: You helped me move, so I owe you a drink.

Tips.title: Not Monetary Only
Tips.description: 'Owe' isn't limited to money; it can also refer to returning kindness or acts.
Tips.example: You've been so generous, I owe you a huge thank you!

senses.de: To feel that you should do something for someone because they have done something for you
senses.ex: He refused the offer, saying he didn't want to owe anyone.

Tips.title: Moral Debt
Tips.description: Use 'owe' to express feeling a moral debt for someone's past help or support to you.
Tips.example: You stood by me, so I owe you my support now.

Tips.title: Emotional Reciprocity
Tips.description: The word 'owe' can convey a sense of emotional duty, similar to loyalty or gratitude.
Tips.example: After all you've done, I owe you my loyalty.

Tips.title: Social Exchange
Tips.description: 'Owe' often implies social relationships where favors or kindness are exchanged.
Tips.example: I owe you a favor now that you've helped me.

senses.de: To have a debt of a certain amount
senses.ex: He still owes $1000 on his car loan.

Tips.title: Financial Context
Tips.description: Use 'owe' when discussing financial debts and the amounts due.
Tips.example: I owe more on my mortgage than my house is worth.

Tips.title: Precise Amounts
Tips.description: Use 'owe' to indicate a specific sum of money that needs to be paid back.
Tips.example: We still owe $200 for the laptop we bought.

Tips.title: Ongoing Payment
Tips.description: Use 'owe' for amounts still unpaid over time, like loans or ongoing bills.
Tips.example: She owes on her student loans each month.

Debit.wordDefinition:
Debit refers to the process of recording an entry on the left side of an accounting ledger to indicate an increase in an asset or a decrease in a liability or equity, and can also refer to using a debit card to withdraw money from a bank account.

Debit is related to accounting and money management, while owe is related to owing someone else money.

quotes.Text: You will find men who want to be carried on the shoulders of others, who think that the world owes them a living. They don't seem to see that we must all lift together and pull together.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Henry Ford

quotes.Text: If people work for me over the years, I expect them to be paid what they're owed, but I don't expect them to be paid more than they earn.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Dolly Parton

quotes.Text: When I was in N.W.A. and didn't get paid all the money I was owed, that's when the business side of showbiz hit me.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Ice Cube

quotes.Text: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Mark Twain

quotes.Text: To the living we owe respect, but to the dead we owe only the truth.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Voltaire

quotes.Text: We owe it to the fans to do a tour around the world.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Steven Adler

quotes.Text: Some people feel that the world owes them a living.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Clint Eastwood

quotes.Text: What did I owe the rest of the world? Nothing.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Bob Dylan

quotes.Text: Respect is what we owe; love, what we give.
quotes.Title: English Poet
quotes.Name: Philip James Bailey

quotes.Text: All I owe the world is my art.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Sherman Alexie
